title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3189/87 of 23 October 1987 fixing the prices to be used to calculate the value of agricultural products in intervention storage and to be carried forward to 1988
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 3189/87
of 23 October 1987
fixing the prices to be used to calculate the value of agricultural products in intervention storage and to be carried forward to 1988
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The carry-over prices to be used to calculate the value of agricultural products in intervention storage and to be carried forward to the 1988 financial year shall be recorded by the paying agencies for the agricultural products in public intervention storage under their responsibility at 30 September 1987. The Member States shall notify the Commission not later than 30 November 1987 and the carry-over prices recorded.

The carry-over price of a stored product shall be the average buying-in price for the accounting period just ended, account being taken of stock carried over from the preceding accounting period assessed at the preceding carry-over price and also of the depreciations carried out in the accounting period.

As regards the prices to be applied pursuant to Article 4 (3) of Council Regulation (EEC) No 3247/87 (6) in the case of an accident, and for transfers of agricultural products between two intervention agencies as provided for in Regulations (EEC) No 1322/85 (7), (EEC) No 1341/86 (8) and (EEC) No 1870/87 (9), the Commission shall establish the carry-over prices on the basis of the carry-over prices recorded in accordance with Article 1.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
